intro: Ptarmica salicifolia subsp. cartilaginea, commonly known as the cartilaginous woodruff, is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. The subspecies is distinguished by its soft, cartilaginous texture of the flower parts, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. This plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in herbal medicine.
